bug.author: atsuik
bug.summary: Manage Contributors cannot distinguish user name with numerical characters
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: I tried to manage contributors to a namespace with Manage Contributors in central bashboard. Our user names are distinguish individuals from numerical characters. Such as
a001@example.com a002@example.com ...
Manage Contributors creates rolebindings.rbac.authorization.k8s.io and servicerolebindings.rbac.istio.io for a001@example.com which name user-a-example-com-clusterrole-edit. Since numerical characters are omitted from the resource names, I could not add a002@example.com to contributors. What did you expect to happen: I expected that the resource name for a001@example.com is user-a001-example-com-clusterrole-edit. Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): v0.6.2 kfctl version: (use kfctl version): v0.6.2 Kubernetes platform: (e.g. minikube): kubeadm Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): v1.15.1 OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Ubuntu18.04
